metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11642 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 has a NULL pointer dereference in the WriteMAPImage() function in coders/map.c when processing a non-colormapped image, a different vulnerability than CVE-2017-11638. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-11642` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.26-4
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.26-4
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.26-4
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.26-4
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.26-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-4').
